definition:
The Mangoldt function $\Lambda$ is defined by $$\Lambda (n) = 
\begin{cases}
\ln p, &\text{if $n=p^k$, where $p$ is a prime and $k$ is a natural number $\geq 1$}\\
0, &\text{otherwise}
\end{cases}$$

The Moebius Inversion Formula leads to the identity
$\Lambda (n) = \sum_{d|n} \mu (n/d) \ln d = - \sum_{d|n} \mu (d) \ln d$.
